item.title: Using development snapshots
item.description: Sometimes there is a need to use a development version of a SeedStack component in your project, for testing purposes. This guide will help you configure Maven to access SeedStack SNAPSHOT dependencies.

item.title: Conversion to WAR
item.description: SeedStack projects created by the generate goal of the SeedStack Maven plugin are designed to be run from command-line with an embedded Web server. You can convert this kind of project to a classic WAR.

item.title: Dump effective configuration
item.description: The effective-config goal produces a YAML dump of the configuration as scanned, parsed and aggregated by SeedStack. This will show the global configuration as the application sees it.

item.title: Dump effective test configuration
item.description: The effective-test-config goal produces a YAML dump of the test configuration as scanned, parsed and aggregated by SeedStack. This will show the global configuration as the application sees it, including the test classpath.

item.title: Encrypting secrets
item.description: The crypt goal encrypts the given argument using the application configured master key store and the specified alias. This allows to encrypt sensitive configuration values.

item.title: Hot-reloading
item.description: The watch goal runs any self-executable SeedStack application in hot-reloading mode.

item.title: JAR Packaging
item.description: The package goal packages any self-executable SeedStack application in a Capsule. A Capsule is a way of packaging and running any application with all its dependencies from a unique plain executable JAR.

item.title: List all configuration options
item.description: The config goal dumps all the configuration options available in the project.

item.title: Project generation
item.description: To create a SeedStack project from scratch you can use generate goal from the SeedStack Maven Plugin. This goal is invoked from the command line.

item.title: Running
item.description: The run goal runs any self-executable SeedStack application directly from the command line.

item.title: Shell function
item.description: To simplify the invocation of the SeedStack plugin you can define the following UNIX shell function in your profile: function seedstack { if [ -z "$1" ]; then echo "Usage: seedstack GOAL [ARGS]..." return 1 fi GOAL=$1 shift mvn -q -Dargs="$*" org.seedstack:seedstack-maven-plugin:$GOAL } This enables you to execute goals which use an args system property with real arguments: seedstack config application.basePackages Which is the equivalent of: mvn -q -Dargs="application.

item.title: Usage
item.description: The SeedStack Maven plugin provides goals to manage SeedStack-based artifacts.
